questions.stem: Vertical infection includes which of the following?
Which of the following is an example of Actively Acquired Natural Immunity?
Which statement is true about the endemic spread of infectious diseases?
options: The disease is constantly present in the community.
All cases are interrelated regarding time and place.
There is an increased number of cases significantly more than the usual pattern.

questions.stem: Which of the following is characteristic of carriers?
options: They are infectious and epidemiologically more dangerous than cases.
They never act as a source of infection.
They show no shedding of the infectious agent.
They have recognizable signs and symptoms.

questions.stem: Which statement is true about seroprophylaxis?
options: It must be given before exposure.
There are no available human preparations.
It gives rapid but temporary protection.
Supervision of contacts for the incubation period of the disease.
Contacts are excluded from school or work.
Contacts are isolated with concurrent disinfection.

questions.stem: An anti-tetanus injection containing antibodies given for a contaminated wound is an example of:

options: Data generated by reporting sources without request.
Collection of data for a relatively limited period of time by regular outreach.
Cross-sectional studies to determine the prevalence of selected diseases.
Cohort studies to define the incidence of selected diseases.

questions.stem: Herd immunity occurs when the vaccination of a significant portion of a population provides protection for individuals who are not immune.
In biological transmission, insects play an active role in the transmission of infection from a reservoir to an exposed host.
Direct droplet infection can be transmitted by droplet nuclei and dust.
